channel.title: XCode Compiler Error on Andrew Bancroft
channel.description: Recent content in XCode Compiler Error on Andrew Bancroft

item.title: Swift Optionals? Don’t Forget to Unwrap!
item.description: There is a compiler error that throws me off every time I see it. It takes the form, ‘ClassName?’ does not have a member named ‘memberName’ This can happen when you’ve declared a variable as an optional, but forget to unwrap that optional when you attempt to call a method on it. For example, given this class definition: class Bird { var family: String var color: String init(family: String, color: String) { self.
